item.title: DIY Reactive Model Store using RxJava
item.description: In the last few years on Android, we’ve seen an explosion of architectures based on the idea of a unidirectional data flow. I was first exposed to this idea while working on an MVI-based app using RxJava. One of the key concepts in MVI is to cleanly manage changes to your application state. The Model Store pattern is key in achieving this. Working with Immutable State So, what does a Model Store do, exactly?

item.title: About
item.description: This is my personal tech blog. Opinions and content are my own. Blog stack Uses Hugo to generate content, Hyde for theming, netlify for deployment and hosting.
